reviews.review_msg: Such a disorganized lecture notes and non- readable hand writing. Overall, this class is  so  Messy.

My favourite prof at SFU. He's very clear, knowledgable, and helpful. Those long assignments had me well prepared for his exams. He did not only teach me knowledge in stats, but also its applications. If you want to learn stats, take courses with him!

This class is a lot of work, but totally worth it. You learn some really interesting stuff.. but it helps if you're into the topic.  Carl is a great teacher, really knows his stuff and wants you to learn. show up for class and listen and take notes.

I found it difficult to concentrate on hardcore computing language at 8:30am; it would better if this was an afternoon course.  This weekly assignments have WAY too many parts; guarantee a loss of brain cells by the end of the term.  Also, cross your fingers that your TMs this term slack off and do not read everything you hand in

Carl is a great prof, especially for those that actually want to learn. The weekly assignments are a lot of work but they make sure that you learn the material. He is frequently available to answer any questions, whether after class or by simply dropping by his office. This course actually teaches things that are applicable to a career.

this teacher is ridiculous, gives assignment before school starts, and the most ridiculous thing is that he gives no help at all when student have problems. His email reply is as follow: Due to a large number of students, blah blah blah, WTF, if you are no use, why are you even here. SO FREAKING BAD !

He is really nice prof. He has open office hour policy, so everytimes if you have a question, he is in office.Midterms and Final exams are fair.assignments were really hard, but I felt I learn a lots from this course.
too much assignments. i have to spend the whole weekends on his assignment.
